Basic Information.name: Unique ID
Basic Information.help: Global unique ID of this object.

Basic Information.name: Unique Name
Basic Information.help: Global unique Name of this object.

Basic Information.name: Owner ID
Basic Information.help: ID of user who creates this object.

Basic Information.name: Owner Group ID
Basic Information.help: ID of group of user who creates this object.

Basic Information.name: Original Object ID
Basic Information.help: ID of source object of this object, if this object is a copy of an existing object.

Basic Information.name: Child Object IDs
Basic Information.help: ID of all child objects, if this object is a container object.

Basic Information.name: Group Name
Basic Information.help: Please enter the name (or abbreviation) of your department and group.

Basic Information.name: Project Name
Basic Information.help: Please enter a unique name for your project.

Basic Information.name: Date of Execution.
Basic Information.help: Please enter the date, on which the experiment was performed.

Basic Information.name: Start Time
Basic Information.help: Please enter the date, on which the experiment was started.

Basic Information.name: Contact Person
Basic Information.help: Please enter the names and departments of the contact persons or principal investigators who are responsible for this entry and should be contacted for further questions.

Basic Information.name: Root Folder ID
Basic Information.help: ID of the root folder where additional experiment data are stored.

Basic Information.name: Dataset ID
Basic Information.help: ID of the dataset this experiment belongs to..

Basic Information.name: Description
Basic Information.help: Please enter a more detailed description of this experiment.

Setup.name: Additional Information
Setup.help: Please enter additional information about the setup that is not recorded by the microscope software.

Specimen.name: Type of Specimen
Specimen.help: Please enter information about the type of specimen you used.

Specimen.name: Subclassification
Specimen.help: Please enter the subclassification of the specimen you used.

Specimen.name: Preparation
Specimen.help: Please provide information about how the specimen was prepared by entering a description and placing links to SOPs. Enter the dates at which the critical steps have been performed. Example: Cells were seeded on coverslips on 2015/02/24 and transfected on 2015/02/25.

Specimen.name: Transfection
Specimen.help: Please provide information about the transfection procedure by entering a description and placing links to SOPs. Please enter the type and amount of the used plasmid (link to the DNA amplification database). Example: HEK293 cells were transfected of [link to DNA amplification database] using the [link to SOP] technique.

Specimen.name: RNA-Injection
Specimen.help: Please provide information about the RNA preparation and injection procedures. Please enter the type and amount of the used RNA, and the link to the RNA batch. Example: Xenopus laevis oocytes were injected  of [link to RNA amplification database] using the [link to SOP] technique

Specimen.name: Incubation
Specimen.help: Please provide information about the incubation procedure by entering a description and placing links to SOPs. Following informations are important: Chemicals/drugs/stock solutions; conditions during the incubation (temperature, humidity, O2/CO2-content)

Specimen.name: Fixation
Specimen.help: Please provide information about the fixation procedure by entering a description and placing links to SOPs.

Solutions.name: Bath Solution
Solutions.help: Please provide information about the solutions used during the experiment by entering a description and placing links to SOPs and the solution/drug database.

Solutions.name: Pipette Solution
Solutions.help: Please provide information about the pipette solutions used during the experiment by entering a description and placing links to SOPs and the solution/drug database

Additional Notes.name: Rating of Experiment
Additional Notes.help: Please rate the experiment by chosing a category from the list box or entering your own grade. Include report on errors that have occurred.

Additional Notes.name: Tags
Additional Notes.help: Here, you can assign tags to your experiment. In this way it is possible to highlight good measurements or label experiments that have been included in one study.

Additional Notes.name: Other Information
Additional Notes.help: Please enter and link all further information which is important to the experiment.

Additional Notes.name: Notes
Additional Notes.help: Please enter and link all further information which is important to the experiment.
